Container.Name: NginxProxyManager
Container.Overview: Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt. [br][br] Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] For this container to be accessible from the internet, make sure ports [b]80[/b] and [b]443[/b] on the internet side of your router are properly forwarded to this container. See the documentation for more details.[br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] After a fresh install, the default username/password to connect to the management interface are: [b]admin@example.com[/b]/[b]changeme[/b].
Container.Description: Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt. [br][br] Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-nginx-proxy-manager/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] For this container to be accessible from the internet, make sure ports [b]80[/b] and [b]443[/b] on the internet side of your router are properly forwarded to this container. See the documentation for more details.[br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]Note:[/b][/span] After a fresh install, the default username/password to connect to the management interface are: [b]admin@example.com[/b]/[b]changeme[/b].
Container.Changes:
[font size=4][center]Nginx Proxy Manager Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.9.2[/b][/font] (2020-07-10) - Fixed an issue where the container would fail to start if custom Nginx files are mounted by Docker.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.1[/b][/font] (2020-07-10) - Improved compatibility by disabling usage of SSE4.2 in OpenResty.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.0[/b][/font] (2020-07-09) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.3.1.
[font size=3][b]v1.8.1[/b][/font] (2020-05-21) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.4.
[font size=3][b]v1.8.0[/b][/font] (2020-04-15) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.3.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.4[/b][/font] (2020-04-08) - Fixed issue where generated proxy host config would use incorrect ports.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.3[/b][/font] (2020-04-07) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.2.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.2[/b][/font] (2020-04-06) - Fixed generation of resolvers.conf when IPv6 is involved.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.1[/b][/font] (2020-04-06) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.1.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.0[/b][/font] (2020-03-16) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.2.0. - Now using baseimage v2.4.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Make sure the tzdata is installed.
[font size=3][b]v1.6.0[/b][/font] (2019-10-10) - Rotate Nginx log files. - Added tool to reset password of a user of the management interface.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.3[/b][/font] (2019-09-04) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.14.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.2[/b][/font] (2019-08-20) - Use baseimage based on Alpine 3.9. - This fixes TLS1.3 support. - Keep the `fastcgi.conf` and `fastcgi_params` Nginx configuration files.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.1[/b][/font] (2019-07-02) - Fixed issue where the wrong SSL protocols/ciphers were used.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.0[/b][/font] (2019-05-09) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.13. - Now using baseimage v2.4.2, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.2[/b][/font] (2019-04-18) - Fixed issue where using a hostname for the upstream proxy host would not work.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.1[/b][/font] (2019-04-10) - Updated Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.12. - Fixed a directory traversal vulnerability.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.0[/b][/font] (2019-03-05) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager version 2.0.11.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.1[/b][/font] (2019-02-21) - During startup, make sure there is no migration lock held.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.0[/b][/font] (2019-02-21) - Make sure to upgrade the database if required. - Properly notify the supervisor when the database is ready. - Make sure to not use the database directory if it was not initialized successfully. - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.9. - Fixed issue where HTTP/2 option could not be disabled. - Added HSTS settings.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.1[/b][/font] (2019-01-26) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.9. - Increased custom SSL certificate file size limit.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2019-01-07) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.8. - Added the ability to enable/disable hosts. - IP ranges are now fetched dynamically.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2019-01-03) - Upgraded Nginx Proxy Manager to version 2.0.7. - Added HTTP/2 option for SSL enabled hosts. - Added upstream SSL option for proxy hosts.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.1[/b][/font] (2018-12-19) - Fixed an issue where creation of an access list would fail.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2018-12-19) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port used to access the web interface of the application.

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTP requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>80</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>80</b>.

Config.Name: HTTPs Port
Config.Description: Port used to serve HTTPs requests.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Your router should be configured to forward port <i>443</i> to this port. If your router doesn't allow setting the destination/internal IP address, this <b><i>must</i></b> be set to <b>443</b>.
